Raw Material Extraction.description: The extraction of raw materials such as metals and minerals required for producing smartphone components, including the sourcing of Gorilla Glass and aluminum.
Raw Material Extraction.rationale: Essential for understanding the environmental impact of mining and extracting initial raw materials used in the smartphone.

Production of Intermediate Components.description: The processing of extracted raw materials into usable components like circuit boards, display panels, and camera modules.
Production of Intermediate Components.rationale: Critical to assess the environmental footprint of the transformation of raw materials into specific components.

Eco-friendly Packaging Production.description: The design and production of sustainable packaging materials for the product.
Eco-friendly Packaging Production.rationale: Incorporates Samsung's initiative to use eco-friendly packaging to mitigate environmental impacts.

Transport of Raw Materials.description: Logistics involved in transporting raw materials from source to manufacturing sites.
Transport of Raw Materials.rationale: Significant in understanding emissions and energy usage related to logistics.

Transportation of Intermediate Component.description: Shipping intermediate components to the assembly plant.
Transportation of Intermediate Component.rationale: Helps capture the logistical footprint in the formation of the product.

Assembly of Smartphone.description: The process of assembling different components to create the fully functional Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra.
Assembly of Smartphone.rationale: Central to capturing the manufacturing phase of the lifecycle.

Testing and Quality Assurance.description: Ensuring each smartphone meets quality standards through rigorous testing.
Testing and Quality Assurance.rationale: Ensures product reliability but also contributes to energy and resource consumption.

Distribution to Retail.description: Moving finished products from factories to various retail outlets and warehouses.
Distribution to Retail.rationale: Ensures the logistics aspects during the product's life cycle are accounted for.

N/A.description: Installation is not applicable as the smartphone does not require professional installation.
N/A.rationale: Smartphones are user-ready out of the box and require no specialized installation.

Product Usage.description: The operational phase where end users utilize the functionalities of the smartphone.
Product Usage.rationale: Includes aspects such as energy consumption during use and related emissions.

Software Updates.description: Regular updates to improve efficiency and functionality, impacting energy consumption.
Software Updates.rationale: Software updates can alter resource use, making this phase significant in the use stage.

Repair Services.description: Repairing hardware defects or damage occurring during usage.
Repair Services.rationale: Influences sustainability through lifespan extension and maintenance.

N/A.description: Replacement process is deemed non-essential as the product does not have short lifecycle components typically requiring replacement.
N/A.rationale: Modern smartphones generally do not require frequent component replacements.

Refurbishment.description: Process of refurbishing smartphones to restore functionality for resale or reuse.
Refurbishment.rationale: Promotes circular economic benefits and sustainability.

Charging.description: Energy usage during battery charging of the smartphone.
Charging.rationale: Represents a significant part of energy consumption during the use phase.

N/A.description: Water use is not applicable as the smartphone does not require water during its usage.
N/A.rationale: Smartphones do not use significant amounts of water during the operation phase.

Decommissioning of Device.description: Actions involved in the collection and processing of used smartphones for disposal or recycling.
Decommissioning of Device.rationale: Reflects efforts to minimize waste and transition towards sustainable practices.

Transport to Recycling Facilities.description: Moving decommissioned devices to recycling or disposal sites.
Transport to Recycling Facilities.rationale: Examines logistical impacts in the end-of-life phase.

Recycling Process.description: The breakdown and recycling of materials from decommissioned Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra devices.
Recycling Process.rationale: Essential for evaluating sustainability and resource recovery aspects.

N/A.description: Final disposal processes are minimized due to recycling and refurbishment efforts.
N/A.rationale: Samsung's recycling programs aim to mitigate the volume of waste going to landfill.
